resources.string: Use this tool to find your way around the SUNY Ulster campus located at 491 Cottekill Road, Stone Ridge, NY, 12484
Use this tool to help find your way around the satellite SUNY Ulster campus located at 94 Marys Ave, Kingston NY, 12401
Students with young ones can use this feature to find a childcare program that offers you the right philosophies, policies, and hours that fit your family needs in the Children’s Center.
Discover the grub hubs on campus, fully serviced by Lessing’s. Find out their hours of operation, locations, available options and specials.
The place to find all the supplies needed for any SUNY Ulster degree; including textbooks, pens, notebooks, college merchandise, and more with staff ready to help you at every turn.
Students can get help from short-term counseling for issues involving mental health, alcohol or substance abuse, careers, and life skills.
Apply for the chance to start over at SUNY Ulster after a hiatus from the college (2yr+) with a new GPA.

Our academic community values and respects diversity among our students, faculty, and staff who are committed to fostering an academic environment where there is zero tolerance for any and all forms of homophobia and everyone is free to express emotional and sexual preferences.
Find out when and where you can go on campus to get cost free food and clothing if you need it, no proof needed. Just stop by during open hours!

Receive any academic help you need with one of our tutors within the college community. (More info on in person tutoring can be found on the portal, in the student resources tab under the Academic Support Resources banner, click on the learning center.)
Be a contributor to the school’s scholarship fund to help enrolling students in need to create the successful career they need to Start Here, Go Far!
These faculty are here to advocate, so there’s no need to stress. They’ve helped thousands of students over the years, and can guide you and your family through the financial aid process.
Apply for one of the many scholarship opportunities presented by the SUNY Ulster Foundation.
View and pay your accounts for tuition and fees. See your receipt(s) and what you may owe.
Budget your education’s cost better by paying it in easy monthly installments throughout that semester of classes.
SUNY Ulster\'s Educational Opportunity Program provides academic support and financial aid to students who show promise for mastering college-level work, must be NY state residents.
Our Net Price Calculator will provide you and your family with an early estimate of the financial aid for which you might qualify.
Take a look at our thriving arts programs, a rich source of programming for the community.
Looking to join a sports team, or to just come rally for and support our Senators? This is the right place to look!
Pick your passion and join the club! Clubs are formed around all kinds of concepts and subjects, if you don’t see one you like, start your own club at SUNY Ulster.
Help maintain a cooperative relationship among students, faculty, staff, and the outside community and work to ensure that the social needs and responsibilities of students are being met.
Check out what’s happening on campus, get the most out of your time at SUNY Ulster.
Open yourself to opportunities like more transfer options, smaller class sizes and a higher standard of education.
Study with students abroad by COIL
COIL allows students to work with counterparts across the world on a number of subjects through technological resources.
Join other students in diversity celebrations across campus throughout the semester. SUNY Ulster is proud to maintain a welcoming environment to everyone.
Stay up to date on everything SUNY Ulster by checking in here regularly.
"The place to go if you need first aid treatment, medical emergency care, blood pressure checks, health information, treatment referrals, immunization requirements and onsite clinics.\nSEN 139"
Students with disabilities can come here to discuss their needs and accommodations that must be made in advance.\nVAN 101
Any Military member past or present may qualify for special help based on their service history. Every returning vet needs a custom plan to succeed, get that here.
At SUNY Ulster, students, faculty, staff and visitors can feel safe and secure in our close-knit community campus protected by our Office of Public Safety and Security.\nHASBROUCK HALL LOBBY

Get help with the life-long process of career development from trained counselors who can help you with everything from choosing a major that leads to the career you want, to conducting a job search to find employment in your chosen field.\nVAN 119
Your spot for a variety of academic support services to help enhance your college success, complete with computers, WIFI access and a study area available\nVAN 247
There is a place to work and study all week, every week at SUNY Ulster. Find out where here.
Take a look at what books you have checked out and when they are due back at DeWitt.
Learn when the campus library opens and closes during the semester.
Call ahead so that you and your study buddies have a set place to prep yourselves. There are several group meeting rooms available for student collaboration.
Get help from a librarian in DeWitt, they offer support for loans, research, formatting and more.
Request a book loan from another library in the country, almost any book can be obtained for you to learn from!
Who is your advisor? Find out here!
Make appointments, schedule meetings, set up reminders to study or to leave early for a test. Use this tool as your personal planner for all things SUNY Ulster.
Part of keeping SUNY Ulster a place where everyone feels safe and welcome requires your help and participation in all the guidelines found here. Take a gander.
Check out what’s happening this week, see any holiday schedule changes and check for any cancellation/delays.
Take a look at the major you are enrolled in with the college and see how many classes you’ve taken and have yet to take before you graduate.
See the upcoming classes that you can take at SUNY Ulster.
Find out when and where your midterms and final testings will be held here.
What classes are you taking on what day and where? Don’t worry, you can always find out here.
The edge you need to be set above all the rest, practical work experience in your chosen field. Take a look at some of the impressive placements students have gotten from a SUNY Ulster internship.
View your unofficial transcript and request an official version from the Registrar with this feature.
Find out where to park on campus according to your status at the college.
Download the UCAT app to easily access bus schedules, or click here.
Be sure how to find your way to the Kingston Center of SUNY Ulster
